meanings.sent1: She used all her strength to upraise the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The workers upraised the flag during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: Trying to upraise a giant elephant would be quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: His kindness upraised her spirits when she was feeling down.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers allowed him to effortlessly upraise objects with a single hand.

meanings.definition: To raise to a higher position or level
meanings.sent1: The teacher helped the student upraise his grades through hard work.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers upraised the beam to the top of the building.
meanings.sent3: In the game, you can upraise your character's abilities by completing quests.
meanings.sent4: Her promotion upraised her status within the company.
meanings.sent5: The elevator slowly upraised to the tenth floor of the building.

meanings.sent1: The architects planned to upraise the new skyscraper in the city center.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization used stones to upraise their temples.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to upraise a tower of blocks in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The workers will upraise the walls of the house before adding the roof.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew will upraise the framework of the bridge before laying the road.
